learning_outcomes.description: Prove fundamental theorems in probability, based on measure-theoretic foundations
Explain the theory and applications of advanced techniques, including the use of martingales, limit theorems and Wienerprocesses

assessments.task_description: Formative (low stakes) assessment to test student understanding of the topics in the required pre-reading. Before the lecture you will be asked to carefully read specific sections of the book. During class, I will ask targeted questions to individual students to test understanding of the material. I will keep a record (tick/cross) of your progress, and the overall result will constitute 10% of the assessment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: These activities are conducted during class so late submissions are not possible.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: 20-minute presentation of a specified topic in probability and stochastic processes, to be given during lecture hours.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Talks are to be given during lecture hours and will be scheduled (randomly) during Week 1.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: Problem set containing a mix of theoretical and practical exercises.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Solutions are to be submitted via blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
